Welcome to Planetbase
In Planetbase you control a group of human pioneers in the not so distant future trying to establish an outpost on a remote planet.
Camera

First thing is to learn the basic camera controls.(n)(n)To pan the camera, use the (camera_move_keys) keys or place the mouse at the edges of the screen.(n)(n)To rotate the camera, use the (camera_rotate_keys) keys or drag the middle mouse button.
You can check out the full camera controls in the help menu.
Structures
The top priority after landing is to build some basic structures to keep your people alive.(n)(n)You can build structures using the main menu, situated on the top left of the screen.
Most structures require Metal and Bioplastic to be built. You have a limited supply of these in the Colony Ship, you should be extremely careful when spending it.
First thing to do is to build an Oxygen Generator so your colonists can breathe when the oxygen in their space suits runs out.
Power
The Oxygen Generator requires power to operate. Power can be generated with a Solar Panel.
Connections
Now that the Solar Panel is placed you need to connect it to the Oxygen Generator.
Connecting structures allows them to share power and water, and in the case of interior structures allows colonists to walk between them.
To connect two structures you will need to: click on one of them, then click on the other, if a connection is possible, a connection button will appear.
Note that you will only be able to place new structures in such way that they can be connected to existing ones. Potential connections are indicated by a green line.
Water
The Oxygen Generator also needs a water supply to function, so you will need to build a Water Extractor.
Water and power generation structures don't need to be directly connected to the destination structure, they just need to be part of the same connection grid.
The Airlock
Now you should build an Airlock so your colonists can get inside the base.
The Airlock is slow to use, later on you might want to build more than one to avoid congestion.
Eat and drink
Your Colony Ship contains some food supplies, and you can get water from the Water Extractor. You can now build a Canteen so your colonists can eat and drink.
Note that interior structures always need to be connected to at least one other interior structure, so colonists can move between them.
Components
Some structures can have components placed in them, these provide additional functionality.
You should now build some components in the Canteen: A Table for people to eat, a Drinking Fountain to get water, and a Video Screen for some basic entertainment.
To build components, click on the structure to select it, then click on the edit button.
You colonists will now use the Canteen components when they need to eat or drink.
Tops
Sometimes you might want to have a closer look at what's going on inside your base. You can use the Show Tops menu button ((toggle_show_tops_key) key) to hide/show the roofs of the buildings
When the tops are disabled, you can select components or colonists inside the base and see their status.
Dead Ends
The next structure to build is the Dorm so your colonists can sleep.
Some structures like the Dorm are dead ends: they can only be connected to one other structure. You should probably take this into account when designing your base.
Power Storage

Structures require varying amounts of power to function.(n)At any given time, if the base requires more power than produced by the generators, structures will shut down, which could easily have fatal consequences.

Solar Panels only work during the day, so if you intend to survive the night, you will need to build some Wind Turbines, that can produce power all day, and Power Collectors, that can store power for later use.
Most structures can be built in different sizes, larger structures require more resources, but provide additional space and functionality.
You can use the Mouse Wheel (or (camera_zoom_keys) keys) to select the structure size when placing them.

Power management is a critical part of running your base, you will typically need a combination of several Solar Panels, Wind Turbines and Power Collectors to ensure there is a constant flow of electricity.
Food
One of the main challenges you will face will be to maintain a constant supply of food for your colonists.
Food is usually grown in Vegetable Pads in the Bio-Dome and then processed in the Meal Maker in the canteen.
Note that Vegetable Pads need to be maintained by Biologists, if not they will decay and eventually stop producing.
Recycle
Most structures, including the Colony Ship can be recycled to get back resources from them
Note that you will only be able to recycle structures if this doesn't isolate any of the existing ones.
Mine
In order to survive in the medium term, you will need to produce more resources so you can build more advanced structures.
You can build a Mine to extract Ore from it.(n)Mines have to be built at the base of a mountain, and they need another structure nearby, to be connected to.
Processing Plant
The Processing Plant is the structure where raw materials are processed into refined resources.
The Metal Processor component can generate Metal from Ore.

Now your Workers will start going to the Mine to extract Ore.(n)They will then take the Ore to the Metal Processor and convert it into Metal.(n)Later on you will be able to use Bots to perform some of these tasks.
Bioplastic
The other construction resource is Bioplastic. Bioplastic is produced from Starch in the Bioplastic Processor.
Starch is produced from some vegetables in the Bio-Dome, like rice or wheat.(n)Not all vegetables are starchy, and the ones that are, produce less food.

Colonists and Carrier Bots will take the right resources to the required components so that they can produce.(n)You can control production by disabling components, or by lowering the priority or a particular structure.
Spares

Solar Panels and Wind Turbines need to be maintained periodically with Spares. If you fail to do this, they will stop functioning.(n)(n)Spares are produced in the Spares Workshop component in the Factory structure.
This tutorial has so far been forcing you to place structures at predetermined locations, but from now on you will be free to place them wherever you wish.
Note that Factory components are operated by Engineers, not Workers.
Health
Every base has to have some basic Sick Bay so you can provide treatment for injured miners and sick colonists.
Medics can heal people in the Sick Bay using Medical Supplies.
Make sure to keep your colonists's health levels monitored at all times. Injured colonists will not work, but will still consume resources from the colony.
Medical Supplies
You only have a limited amount of Medical Supplies in your Colony Ship, so you will need to produce more at some point.
A Medic can create Medical Supplies from Bioplastic and Medicinal Plants (grown in the Bio-Dome) in a Workbench (in the Lab)
Always ensure you have functioning Sick Bay and good stock of Medical Supplies, you never know when the next medical emergency will be.
New Arrivals
Once you have enough resources to keep everyone alive you can build a Landing Pad to allow more colonists in.
Note that new Colonists will only arrive if the base is well run.
On your own
You now know the basics, and can start building your own colony. Good luck!
